TopicTitle: Diffuse highlight is rotated 90 degrees on my bump-mapped rocket.

Articles.Content:
So, I made a booster with a KSP/Bumped texture. 95% of the bump-map is empty, transparent - only a scarce few elements are 'bumps' on the otherwise smooth surface.

These are the material and texture settings:

 

And this is the booster, as seen with the Sun behind the camera, and as seen "from the dark side", camera pointed at the Sun.

 

Note the highlights and shades on the fins and the probe core, comparing to the rocket. Half of the "night side" is practically glowing!

What did I do wrong? How do I fix it?
Uncheck the 'create from grayscale' on the texture settings in Unity.  It is trying to recreate your normal map from an already normal-mapped texture, resulting in wonky normals.
Whoa, so that's what happened. Thanks!
